title: How TO - Become a Front-End Developer

metadata.description: Learn about How TO - Become a Front-End Developer with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: How TO
content_sections.content:
- Become a Front-End Developer

A Front-End Developer is someone who creates websites and web applications.
The Front-End Developer creates things that the user sees.
It is a popular job, and everyone can become a Front-End Developer.
Why become a Front-End Developer
It is fun and creative.
It is flexible - you can work from anywhere!
Many companies are looking for Front-End Developers.
What does a Front-End Developer do
The main responsibility of a Front-End Developer is the
User interface
.
Simply put, create things that the user sees.
Note:
If you don't know what a Front-End Developer is, you can learn more about it in the
What is a Front-End Developer
tutorial.
The difference between Front-End and Back-End is that Front-End refers to how a web page looks, while back-end refers to how it works.
You also think of Front-End as
client-side
and Back-End as
server-side
.
Where do I start
HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the basic languages you need to know to create a website.
To become a Front-End Developer, start with the subjects below, in the following order:
You have to code to learn how to code. Practice a lot!
Create the structure with HTML.
The first thing you have to learn is HTML, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.
Learn HTML »
Style with CSS.
The 
Learn CSS »
Make it interactive with JavaScript.
After studying HTML and CSS, you should learn JavaScript to create dynamic and interactive web pages for your users.
Learn JavaScript »
Have you ever heard about
 Spaces
? Here you can create a free website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Get started for free »
* no credit card required
Learn and practice JavaScript and CSS frameworks and libraries such as:

content_sections.title: Version control with Git
content_sections.content:
-
Learn Git
Knowing the frameworks and libraries will make you more attractive in the job market.
Learning
RESTful APIs
is a bonus. This will allow you to connect the Front-End to the Back-End and its logic.
Relevant skills
A Front-End Developer can have a big tool-box of skills.
Here are some:
Programming languages such as Python, PHP, and SQL
Problem-solving
Graphical design
Typography
Communication and collaboration
SEO
Want to get your first job? Read our article on how to get a developer job in Ten steps.
Start reading »

Everything you need right in the browser. It is easy to use - try it!

summary: This tutorial covers How TO - Become a Front-End Developer concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use How TO - Become a Front-End Developer effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of How TO - Become a Front-End Developer and how to apply it in your projects.
